pull.title: gettransaction: add an argument to decode the transaction
pull.body:
This PR adds a new parameter to the `gettransaction` call : `decode`. If set to `true`, it will add a new `decoded` field to the response. This mimics the behavior of `getrawtransaction`'s `verbose` argument to avoid using 2 calls if we want to decode a wallet transaction (`gettransaction`Â then `decoderawtransaction`).

Fix #16181 .

events.body: Concept ACK, please include tests and a release note.
@promag thank you for the review. I added the changes and will include the tests and release note soon.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16365](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16365.html) (Log RPC parameters (arguments) if -debug=rpcparams by LarryRuane)
* [#16199](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16199.html) (rpc: fix showing wrong amount when not all inputs are from me in gettransaction by shannon1916)
* [#14707](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14707.html) ([RPC] Include coinbase transactions in receivedby RPCs by andrewtoth)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

> Concept ACK, please include tests and a release note.

Since there was no functional test for the `gettransaction` I created a new one. However it only tests the `decoded` field since I don't know if testing other would not be overkill.
Moved the test to [`test/functional/wallet_basic.py`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/test/functional/wallet_basic.py) and used named arguments.
Rebased.
Some minor corrections according to last review.

You could use https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/0b6ba66238c377116bc6c21e19cffbf1b6dfc788#diff-0f596a69ccfb4d07c007cd6fc993898dR50 (not yet in master) to do:
```py
assert_no_key('decoded', self.nodes[0].gettransaction(txid, decode=False))
```
Concept ACK

Rebased.
*(And addressed the spacing nits pointed by @jb55 :-) )*
Concept ACK
@achow101 thank you for the review, rebased to rectify.
ACK a636daba4f61c32ec83d6677b8cff66dbde3fda0 Reviewed code and tested locally
utACK

utACK a636daba4f61c32ec83d6677b8cff66dbde3fda0

Once rebased, I will merge this
Rebased.
You must make linters happy.

No that's a Travis error : `curl: (7) Failed to connect to storage.googleapis.com port 443: Connection timed out`

tree 6643252ba3e9c8d04b428f869253faf3ef331e96

author darosior <darosior@protonmail.com> 1560206570 +0200
committer darosior <darosior@protonmail.com> 1567157929 +0200

gettransaction: add an argument to decode the transaction

This adds a new boolean parameter 'decode' to the gettransaction call, which, if set to true, add a 'decoded' field to the result containing the decoded transaction

events.body: re-utACK 9965940e35c445ccded55510348af228ff22f0e9

Sorry for the post-merge review comment, but would it make sense to call the new parameter `verbose`, to mirror the `verbose` argument in `getrawtransaction`?

If so, we should make that change before v0.19 to avoid an API change.

> Sorry for the post-merge review comment, but would it make sense to call the new parameter `verbose`, to mirror the `verbose` argument in `getrawtransaction`?
> 
> If so, we should make that change before v0.19 to avoid an API change.

This seems like a good idea. You could open a one-line PR and add the milestone to get more feedback.
+1 for API consistency.

comments.body: Unrelated change, remove?
`decode_tx = request.params[2].get_bool()`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1664,13 +1664,14 @@ static UniValue gettransaction(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
         return NullUniValue;
     }
 
-    if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 2)
+    if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 3)
         throw std::runtime_error(
             RPCHelpMan{"gettransaction",
                 "\nGet detailed information about in-wallet transaction <txid>\n",
                 {
                     {"txid", RPCArg::Type::STR, RPCArg::Optional::NO, "The transaction id"},
                     {"include_watchonly", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "false", "Whether to include watch-only addresses in balance calculation and details[]"},
+                    {"decode", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "true", "Whether to add a field with the decoded transaction"},
comments.body: Default to false?
Thought it would be great to fix this nit while passing through, will remove this change

@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@

comments.body: Maybe add the test in test/functional/wallet_basic.py instead?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2019 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Test gettransaction RPC command"""
+
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.util import assert_equal
+
+class GetTransactionTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.setup_clean_chain = True
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+
+    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
+        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        self.test_gettransaction_decoding()
+    
+    def test_gettransaction_decoding(self):
+        self.log.info("Testing gettransaction decoding...")
+        self.nodes[0].generate(101)
+        txid = self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[0].getnewaddress(), 1)
+        #Â False for 'include_watchonly', True for 'decode'
+        tx = self.nodes[0].gettransaction(txid, False, True)
comments.body:
You can use named arguments and drop the comment above (untested):
```py
tx = self.nodes[0].gettransaction(txid=txid, decode=True)
```

+"""Test gettransaction RPC command"""
+
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.util import assert_equal
+
+class GetTransactionTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.setup_clean_chain = True
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+
+    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
+        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        self.test_gettransaction_decoding()
+    
+    def test_gettransaction_decoding(self):
+        self.log.info("Testing gettransaction decoding...")
+        self.nodes[0].generate(101)
+        txid = self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(self.nodes[0].getnewaddress(), 1)
+        #Â False for 'include_watchonly', True for 'decode'
+        tx = self.nodes[0].gettransaction(txid, False, True)


```
git cat-file -p d5ab374c48a7f2708acc5e122044a3a9cfc1ac6a | grep '#.Test "decoded"' | xxd | head -n1
```
